main event: On April 13, 1957, a disc-shaped object was observed stationary for two minutes at ground radar's length.
interesting points: The observation was made using ground radar, indicating a technological means of verification.
The report includes detailed military personnel and locations, adding credibility to the sighting.
The conclusion suggested the possibility of the object being a balloon, but the data was deemed insufficient for a conclusive evaluation.
The document references a color 35mm camera incident at 1730 on the 28th, indicating a potential photographic record of the sighting.
The report includes technical details such as temperature and wind speed, adding a scientific aspect to the observation.
